## After-tax Cost of Debt

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
rd <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.07, sd = 0.005)
tax <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.25, sd = 0.02)
```

Aurora Technologies issues new bonds with a yield to maturity of **`r round(rd*100,2)`**%.  
The corporate tax rate is **`r round(tax*100,2)`**%.  

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q9a"><strong>1. What is the after-tax cost of debt (in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q9a" name="module4_num_q9a" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(rd*(1-tax)*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q9a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ After-tax cost of debt = r<sub>D</sub> × (1 – tax) = **`r round(rd*(1-tax)*100,2)`**%.  
Interest is tax-deductible, so the effective cost of debt is lower than the nominal rate.
</div>
:::
